intro: Sida longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It produces small, dry fruits called capsules, which contain numerous tiny seeds. Sida longipedicellata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
